Package com.shelfsync.services

Class WarehouseItemService

java.lang.Object
com.shelfsync.services.WarehouseItemService
@Service public class WarehouseItemService extends Object
Service for managing warehouse inventory operations.

This service handles the relationship between warehouses and items, including:

  • Quantity changes (inbound, outbound, and transfer operations)
  • Capacity validation to prevent exceeding warehouse maximum capacity
  • Quantity validation to prevent negative quantities
  • Inventory search and aggregation across warehouses

Key business rules enforced:

  • Quantities cannot be reduced below zero
  • Adding items cannot exceed warehouse capacity (calculated as item quantity × cubic feet)
  • All quantity changes are transactional to ensure data consistency

  • Constructor Details

    • WarehouseItemService

  • Method Details

    • applyQuantityChange

      public WarehouseItemResponse applyQuantityChange(Integer warehouseId, Integer itemId, int delta)
      Applies a quantity change to a warehouse item (inbound, outbound, or transfer operation).

      This is the primary method for recording inventory transactions. It handles:

      • Creating new warehouse items when they don't exist (for inbound operations)
      • Updating existing warehouse item quantities
      • Validating that quantities don't go negative
      • Validating that capacity isn't exceeded when adding items

      Business rules enforced:

      • Cannot reduce quantity below zero (throws IllegalArgumentException)
      • Cannot add items that would exceed warehouse capacity (throws IllegalArgumentException)
      • Cannot reduce quantity for non-existent items (throws IllegalArgumentException)

      This method is transactional to ensure data consistency. If any validation fails, the entire operation is rolled back.

      Parameters:
      warehouseId - The ID of the warehouse where the quantity change occurs
      itemId - The ID of the item whose quantity is changing
      delta - The quantity change: positive for adding items (inbound), negative for removing items (outbound), or positive/negative for transfers
      Returns:
      The updated warehouse item response with current quantity
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the operation would result in negative quantity or exceed warehouse capacity. The message is user-friendly and does not expose IDs.
      ResourceNotFoundException - if the warehouse or item does not exist

    • create

      public WarehouseItemResponse create(WarehouseItemDto dto)
      Creates a new warehouse item with the specified initial quantity.

      This method creates a new relationship between a warehouse and an item. Note: This method does not perform capacity validation. For adding inventory, use applyQuantityChange(Integer, Integer, int) which includes capacity checks.

      Parameters:
      dto - The warehouse item data transfer object containing warehouseId, itemId, and quantity
      Returns:
      The created warehouse item response
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - if the warehouse or item does not exist

    • findAll

      public List<WarehouseItemResponse> findAll()
      Retrieves all warehouse items across all warehouses.
      Returns:
      A list of all warehouse items with their warehouse and item details

    • findById

      public WarehouseItemResponse findById(Integer warehouseId, Integer itemId)
      Retrieves a specific warehouse item by warehouse ID and item ID.
      Parameters:
      warehouseId - The warehouse ID
      itemId - The item ID
      Returns:
      The warehouse item response
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - if the warehouse item does not exist

    • searchInventoryByItem

      public List<ItemInventorySummaryResponse> searchInventoryByItem(String q)
      Searches for inventory items by game title or SKU and aggregates quantities across all warehouses.

      This method performs a case-insensitive search on item game titles and SKUs. Results are grouped by item and include:

      • Total quantity across all warehouses
      • Breakdown of quantities by warehouse location

      The search query is trimmed and must not be empty. Partial matches are supported (e.g., searching "Mario" will find "Super Mario Bros").

      Parameters:
      q - The search query string (game title or SKU). Must not be null or empty.
      Returns:
      A list of inventory summary responses, one per matching item, with aggregated quantities
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the search query is null or empty

    • update

      public WarehouseItemResponse update(Integer warehouseId, Integer itemId, WarehouseItemDto dto)
      Updates the quantity of an existing warehouse item.

      This method sets the quantity to an absolute value. For relative quantity changes (increment/decrement), use applyQuantityChange(Integer, Integer, int) instead, which includes capacity and negative quantity validation.

      Note: This method does not validate capacity constraints. It simply sets the quantity to the specified value. Use with caution.

      Parameters:
      warehouseId - The warehouse ID
      itemId - The item ID
      dto - The warehouse item DTO containing the new quantity value
      Returns:
      The updated warehouse item response
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - if the warehouse item does not exist

    • deleteById

      public void deleteById(Integer warehouseId, Integer itemId)
      Deletes a warehouse item, removing the relationship between a warehouse and an item.

      This operation permanently removes the warehouse item record. Any inventory history records associated with this warehouse item are not affected by this deletion.

      Parameters:
      warehouseId - The warehouse ID
      itemId - The item ID
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - if the warehouse item does not exist
